resources.string:
This app is a time management tool and multitasking app that lets you track how you spend your time. The app can also track your time on break. It can be used for short term goals like cooking or workouts as well as tracking long term goals or projects. Adding timers is quick and simple and switching between them only requires swiping the screen. The apps planning feature lets you list what you need to have completed and lets you divide your time between those tasks over a long period of time. This way you can set your goals first, and then try to meet them.


The app was inspired by an article from waitbutwhy.com that highlights how limited and valuable our time is. When we subtract our sleep, time for loved ones, and leisure, there is very limited time left for work. The app will help in ensuring you put it the time needed for work and effectively use it so that you can have a healthy balance of work, leisure, and rest.


Being able to quickly switch between tasks was added to allow having a flexible and reactive schedule instead of a rigid one. I am unable to focus on a single task for too long and my productiveness drops, I find that it helps to switch to another task that I want to complete to refresh myself as well as stay productive.


Other features that aid productiveness are,
 	- parallel alarms for off the cuff alarms,
 	- notifications on how long a break has been going for,
 	- task information like overall time spent doing something as well as time since your last break,
 	- notifications for when you've met your time investment goal, and
 	- the ability to control the app from a notification icon.


If you are interested in the article from waitbutwhy.com about spending your time, the article is called '100 Blocks a Day' written by Tim Urban, and the link
 https://waitbutwhy.com/2016/10/100-blocks-day.html
1. Add new tasks by clicking on the floating action button.\n
2. Specify a name and use the sliders to set how much time you need to spend on this task.\n
3. Then press the check button to create the task.\n
4. The name must be unique, if not, it will change the time of the existing task.\n
5. Click the play button on the corner of the screen to start tracking.\n

6. Use swipe gestures on the home screen to control the time tracker.
 	a. Swipe left or right to switch the task
 	b. Swipe down to track break time.
 	c. Swipe up on the break screen to stop break time.
\n\n7. You can also control the task from the notification icon.
8. You can delete tasks using the close button.\n
- Switching tasks\n \tSwipe left or right at the home screen.\n
- Taking a break\n \tSwipe down at the home screen.\n
- Resuming a task\n \tTo resume tracking a task after taking a break swipe down at the break time screen.\n
- Quick alarm\n \tYou can set an alarm that will run parallel to the main timer. The ringing bell icon indicates that an alarm is already set.\n
- Save and view lists\n \tSwipe up at the home screen. Then press the save button. You can cycle through the lists by swiping up or pressing the next button.\n
- Start or stop the timer\n \tStart or stop time tracking, stopping will also stop the quick alarm. If you only need an alarm its recommended that you create a new task to do so.\n

- Delete task
 	Clicking the close button at a task will do this. You can also do this at the budgeting page.

 - Use a list
 	Use the list that is currently displayed for tracking.

 - New page
 	Creates a new list but deletes the one currently in use.
- Adding time to task\n \tTo add or subtract time from a task you need to press the add task button, then overwrite the task with the new time that you want.\n

1. Swipe up from the home screen to plan your time.

 2. First we set the amount of hours per day that you want to set aside for work at the bottom of the screen.

 3. You can then set how many days you want to monitor your time.

 4. The number on the top shows the total amount of time for the tasks. In brackets it shows the recommended amount of break time you should have (which is 10 min every hour).

 5. Finally you then divide the time you've set among the tasks in the list using the sliders.

 6. The numbers beside the task show how much time will be given to the task.

 7. You can remove tasks by pressing the close button beside the task.
